quiz.title: Solving One-Variable Equations (Quiz 1)
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2 Quiz 1: Solving One-Step Equations
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Basic Equation Solving with One Operation

questions.question: Solve for $x$: $-\frac{2}{3}x = 12$
questions.explanation: Multiply both sides by the reciprocal $-\frac{3}{2}$: $x = 12 \times (-\frac{3}{2}) = -\frac{36}{2} = -18$.

questions.question: Identify the solution set for: $0x = 0$
questions.explanation: This is an identity. Any real number multiplied by $0$ equals $0$, so all real numbers are solutions.

questions.question: Solve for $x$: $|x| = 5$
questions.explanation: Absolute value represents distance from zero. Both $5$ and $-5$ are $5$ units from zero, so $x = 5$ or $x = -5$.

questions.question: Solve for $x$: $-12.5 = -x$
questions.explanation: Divide both sides by $-1$: $12.5 = x$, so $x = 12.5$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered one-step equations, including fractions, decimals, absolute value, and special cases.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand the basics but review fraction operations and absolute value concepts.
scoreMessages.50: A fair attempt. Focus on: 1) Identify the operation, 2) Use inverse operation, 3) Do the same to both sides.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Remember: Addition ↔ Subtraction, Multiplication ↔ Division. Do the same operation to both sides.
